Comment: Is it constitutionally / legally possible?  Sure - these are positions created in offices (whether it's the President's or Congressional or whatever) is able to change and hire to/from as needed.   Functionally is it possible?  Probably not. In major offices, like the White House or big Senate offices, they're both full-time jobs (arguably both actually requiring more time than the average full-time job). And have some overlapping but ultimately pretty different skill sets.  That being said, yes sometimes in smaller offices or teams - you'll have the Chief of Staff double-hatting in another capacity (though unlikely the Press Secretary - while the Press Secretary is often the most visible member of the communications teams, it's actually usually the Communications Director in most offices that is the most senior comms staff - though obviously again, in very small teams, it's often the same person)
